intro: Draconia ledebouriana, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Draconia ledebouriana is often found in tundra and alpine habitats, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
